resources.string:
On Mercedes cars, digital error codes consist of five digits and look something like this: GS 2 3022, where GS denotes the system in which the malfunction occurred, this is the gearbox control system. Next comes the designation of the significance of the malfunction: 0 is not a very serious malfunction, 1 is serious and, if possible, you should try to fix it yourself or contact a service station, 2 means that the operation of the car is prohibited until the malfunction is eliminated.


Decoding the designation of some control units
 WS/FSS – Maintenance system
 MR/PLD – Injection control system
 BS/EPB – Brake control system
 ABS – Anti-lock braking system
 FR/FMR – Driving mode control system
 NR/ENR – Frame level control system
 INS – On-board computer information system, instrument cluster
 GS/EPS – Gearbox control system
 FLA – Pre-heating system
 AGN - Automatic transmission for commercial vehicles
 BS - Brake system control
 EDW - Anti-theft alarm system
 FFB - Radio remote control
 KSA - Comfort opening/closing system
 KOM - Communication interface
 MR/PLD - Engine management system
 PSM - Parameterizable special module
 SIR - Right seat electronics
 SIL - Left seat electronics seats
 SRS - Passive Restraint System
 TCO - Tachograph
 WS - Maintenance System
 ZHE - Additional Heating
 ZV - Central Locking
